function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Decreased effectiveness of UVGI system when fixtures are placed on one side of the room.","Impact":"Reduced ability to kill or inactivate microorganisms, leading to increased risk of disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Install upper-room UVGI systems to provide the most uniform UVGI distribution in the upper air possible.","Technologies":"Upper-room UVGI systems, wider distribution of low-irradiance UV lamps.","People":"Building occupants, public health.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, public health authorities."},{"Description":"Bacteria studied primarily as single cells aerosolized in deionized water, lacking mucus coating, may be more sensitive to UVGI.","Impact":"Misrepresentation of UVGI effectiveness on bacteria with mucus coating, leading to inadequate mitigation strategies.","Mitigation":"Conduct studies on bacteria with mucus coating to understand UVGI effectiveness in real-world conditions.","Technologies":"Laboratory testing with mucus-coated bacteria, simulated real-world conditions for testing.","People":"Public health researchers, epidemiologists.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health authorities."},{"Description":"Use of UVGI for reducing droplet nuclei concentration in the room as an alternative to mechanical ventilation.","Impact":"Reliance on UVGI for reducing droplet nuclei concentration without adequate ventilation, potentially leading to inadequate indoor air quality.","Mitigation":"Combine UVGI with mechanical ventilation systems to achieve optimal reduction of droplet nuclei concentration.","Technologies":"UVGI systems, mechanical ventilation systems.","People":"Building occupants, public health professionals.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, public health authorities."},{"Description":"AHUs including in-duct applications.","Impact":"Potential for air handling units to become sources of contamination if not properly maintained or if UVGI systems are not effectively implemented.","Mitigation":"Ensure proper maintenance of AHUs, including in-duct UVGI installations, and regular inspection of UVGI system effectiveness.","Technologies":"In-duct UVGI systems, AHU maintenance protocols.","People":"HVAC technicians, building maintenance staff, public health professionals.","Owner":"Facility managers, building owners, public health authorities."}]}
